title: Are there any country song in French language? - Quora

response.answer_text: French doesn't really have the concept of country music. But, anyway, a good example would be : Francis cabrel, the countryiest french singer : (Les chemins de traverse, the off beat paths)  ( ma place dans le trafic)  And “ la dame de haute savoie”

Some French singers who started their career in the 60s were enamoured of everything US and followed the style of country music. Eddy Mitchell ("Claude Moine" being his real name) is notorious for this :  French being spoken natively in Northern America, some music in French has a close affinity to country music in English. For example the Acadian Lisa Leblanc in "I' fait chaud" :

Are you aware of this Sirius XM radio station: Ici Musique FrancoCountry Billed as: “100% francophone and Canadian country-folk music.” Some typical artists: Karim Ouellet, Louis-Jean Cormier, Lisa Leblanc, Canailles I’m no expert. I tune in now and again because it is something, well, different. Bonne chance.
For my ideas, a lot of country sing the french language or can said the country that have AUF in there country
